lojbo: .i fanva fa la lalxu .i milxe cnegau fa la gleki
.i ba milxe bo carvi .i panci lo dertu
glico: There will come soft rains and the smell of the ground,
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: There will be mild rains. It smells of the ground.

lojbo: .i le cipni ba sutra bo vofli co certu
glico: And swallows circling with their shimmering sound;

lojbo: .i le banfi ba sanga .i melbi bo vanci
glico: And frogs in the pools singing at night,
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: The frogs will sing. It is a beautiful evening.

lojbo: .i le flaume bo tricu ba blabi se manci
glico: And wild plum trees in tremulous white,

lojbo: .i le gunse ba dasni le fagri bo pimlu
glico: Robins will wear their feathery fire

lojbo: gi'e siclu fe le jai se gleki co simlu
glico: Whistling their whims on a low fence-wire;

lojbo: .i se slabu le jamna fa no cmalu danlu
glico: And not one will know of the war, not one
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: No small animal will know the warriors.

lojbo: .i no stuzi le xarci ba su'o roi canlu
glico: Will care at last when it is done.
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: No place will ever be taken by the weapons.

lojbo: .i no cipni ba xanka fa no jdari tricu
glico: Not one would mind, neither bird nor tree
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: No bird will worry, neither any strong tree

lojbo: fe le fanmo be mi'a noi no da ba skicu
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: about the end of us who no one will tell about.

lojbo: .i la vensa ba cikna ke viska le cmana
glico: And Spring herself, when she woke at dawn,
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: Spring will awakeningly see the mountains.

lojbo: .i te mintu le jalge .i vy. ri na zgana
glico: Would scarcely know that we were gone.
glico gi'e te fanva fo le lojbo: The outcome is equal. Spring doesn't observe it.
